plantCare.watering: Leave the soil dry out in between waterings and mist the foliage regularly.

description: Variety of monstera that is characterized by having larger holes in the leaves. Reaches great size if you take good care of it!

plantCare.temperature: Like the other monsteras, it adapts well to the temperature of your house.
plantCare.light: He likes to live in a corner with lots of but indirect light. Direct sun could burn its leaves.
plantCare.watering: More spraying than watering. You can put her in the shower from time to time.

description: An easy care adaptable plant. Idea to have in the bedroom, as it purifies the environment (I don't say it, NASA says it).

plantCare.temperature: It perfectly withstands temperatures between 5 and 26ºC degrees.
plantCare.light: Avoid direct sunlight. It survives in dimly lit environments, although its leaves will lose color.
plantCare.watering: It will appreciate that you forget to water it. In winter, water it very occasionally or put it in a dish of water for ten minutes.

difficulty: A great option for inexperienced planters. Just remember not to over water.

description: Known as 'the prayer plant' this tropical species is a spectacle of moving leaves and vintage-looking colors.

plantCare.temperature: Being a tropical plant, it feels comfortable with stable and not very cold temperatures.
plantCare.light: Look for a lighted place but no direct sun, it is not good for its leaves.
plantCare.watering: Keep the soil moist but avoid waterlogging. During the winter, water it a little less.

difficulty: Easy to care for if you already have some experience with plants.

description: Tropical plant from the Philippines and Madagascar. It has an amazing flowering and colors, you are going to love it one way or another.

plantCare.temperature: It does not like drafts or temperatures below 15ºC.
plantCare.light: This plant needs good lighting but direct sun should be avoided.
plantCare.watering: Keep the substrate moist and spray its leaves from time to time to maintain a high level of humidity. Many people use mineral or distilled water for irrigation.

difficulty: Intermediate level, if you do not give her the pampering she needs, she will die hopelessly.

description: Beautiful orchid whose leaves resemble the wings of a butterfly, hence its name.

plantCare.temperature: It adapts well to temperatures between 16 and 24ºC and even higher in summer.
plantCare.light: It will be very happy behind a curtain, preferably facing east.
plantCare.watering: It's a bit special. Water it with warm water and only in the morning, since its leaves need to dry throughout the day. Keep the soil moist but don't overdo it, as the plant could rot.

difficulty: It is not the easiest to care for, it requires experience and constant care.

description: This beautiful tropical tree will be the star of your living room. In good conditions it can grow up to the ceiling and if you have it outdoors in the right climate, it will give you flowers and fruits.

plantCare.temperature: It´s tropical, so keep it between 16-24ºC. If you live in frosty areas, keep it indoors.
plantCare.light: It needs a lot of indirect light. If it lacks lighting, its leaves will turn pale.
plantCare.watering: It appreciates that you water it little. Of course, it needs a lot of ambient humidity, spray often or get a humidifier.

difficulty: Easy-peasy if you remember to mist properly.

description: It is known as the 'dragon plant' due to its red sap. It is easy to care for and reaches a spectacular size.

plantCare.temperature: Like all tropical plants, it wants stable temperatures and not to be cold.
plantCare.light: She can live with low lighting (it is the typical plant that you find in offices) but if you provide her with a lot of indirect light she will look beautiful.
plantCare.watering: It requires moisture, but be careful not to get waterlogged or its roots will rot. If it lacks irrigation, its leaves will tell you by turning yellowish.

difficulty: She practically takes care of herself.

description: One of the most loved plants on Instagram. Its round leaves are very striking and it does not require much care.

plantCare.light: She likes light a lot but without the sun touching her directly.
plantCare.watering: Moderate. Let the substrate dry between waterings.

difficulty: Not really difficult. I recommend you turning it from time to time so that it does not lose shape, but do it little by little so as not to disorient the plant.

description: This tropical plant is very appreciated to decorate interiors, its huge leaves resemble elephant ears (hence the name, obviously).

plantCare.temperature: She likes to be warm. If you live in a warm area, you could even grow it outdoors
plantCare.light: Needs to be in a bright space and receive indirect light. If you choose to grow it in the garden, make sure it is in shade or half-shade.
plantCare.watering: Frecuent. Not the option for those who use to forget about watering. Mist is always welcome

difficulty: Make sure she gets the temperature and humidity she needs!

description: Its widened trunk gives it the appearance of a small tree. It blooms throughout the summer and its colors are wonderful.

plantCare.temperature: Needs to live above 10º degrees. Otherwise, remains dormant and loses leaves.
plantCare.light: It´s a sun-lover and bloom beautifully in the bright sun.
plantCare.watering: Only needs watering when the soil gets dry. In winters, you can do it every two or three weeks.

description: Unique shape and compact roseette pattern, it´s found natively on the Canary Islands

plantCare.temperature: Needs to live above 10º degrees. Otherwise, remains dormant and loses leaves.
plantCare.light: It is an outdoor plant, but it can live perfectly in well-lit interiors.
plantCare.watering: It needs a little more moisture than other succulents, so I recommend using a regular substrate and making sure it drains well.

difficulty: Good option if you have some experience with succulents.

description: The pothos is a beautiful plant, it purifies the environment and requires minimal care. Many people underestimate it because it is very common and not fashionable. Don't be like those people and adopt a pothos!

plantCare.temperature: It adapts perfectly to indoor temperatures, you will not have to worry much about this issue.
plantCare.light: Pothos prefer medium to bright indirect sunlight, but can live in lower light conditions.
plantCare.watering: When the leaves start wilting, it is the best time to water it. Water more often in the growing season.

difficulty: Zero. It´s the plant for those who don´t know anything about plants.

description: Its long leaves give it a special appeal. Ideal for growing in a pot.

plantCare.temperature: Too high temperatures harm its flowering. Ideally, it should be kept at 18-20º degrees.
plantCare.light: It needs a lot of light, being exposed to full sun, especially in the growth stage. In winter it tolerates a little less.
plantCare.watering: Without wetting the flowers, use a humidifier daily to increase the humidity of the environment.

difficulty: Half. If you are a beginner, perhaps you should look for other species that need less care.

description: This impressive specimen will be the protagonist in any room. It is very difficult to produce fruit indoors, but it's still beautiful.

plantCare.temperature: Avoid cold temperatures and cold drafts from windows.
plantCare.light: Provide at least eight hours of bright, indirect light.
plantCare.watering: Banana plant needs regular watering and high humidity but she hates to be sitting in water, so look for a well-draining soil mix.

difficulty: Not difficult to grow, typical tropical plant care

description: Original tropical plant that is characterized by the variety of colors of its ribbed leaves that look like leather.

plantCare.temperature: It prefer warm conditions, perfect to grow indoors.
plantCare.light: Croton needs significant exposure to sunlight; without light colors will fade.
plantCare.watering: Water when the top soil it´s dry and remove any excess water collected in the saucer.

difficulty: The biggest challenge is keeping its brightly colored leaves healthy and shiny. Make sure it gets adequate light and watering.
